title: Conus hennequini
text:
Conus hennequini is a species of <a href="sea%20snail">sea snail</a>, a marine <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Conidae">Conidae</a>, the <a href="Conus">cone snails</a> and their allies.
Like all species within the genus "Conus", these snails are <a href="predatory">predatory</a> and <a href="venomous">venomous</a>. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
Distribution.
This marine species occurs in the Caribbean Sea off <a href="Honduras">Honduras</a> and <a href="Martinique">Martinique</a>; in the <a href="Mid-Atlantic%20Ridge">Mid-Atlantic Ridge</a>.
Description.
The maximum recorded <a href="gastropod%20shell">shell</a> length is 23 mm.
Habitat.
Minimum recorded depth is 2 m. Maximum recorded depth is 2 m.
